Posts.Content: BlueFox wrote: http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(14)60488-8/fulltext This study shows that, for any patient with positive nodes, there are very substantial benefits for radiotherapy after Mx in terms of survivorship and reduced recurrence risk. If you have positive nodes but your onc has not recommended you for radiotherapy, may be worth having a further discussion with them and mention this paper. Those of you who are having radiotherapy may also be interested in reading the paper to gain a better understanding of the benefits. iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk Dx 10/2012, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 2/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Benefits of radiotherapy for patients with positive nodes BlueFox kriserts

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2013 06:27PM BlueFox wrote: I am keeping a record with pics of my hair regrowth on my blog: http://iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk/p/chemo-hair-regrowth_16.html After 5 months, it is very thick, but still short and growing slowly.  I don't mind - its my hair and I love it! I started colouring it at 3 months post chemo - no more Chemo White.  I used a temporary hair dye in order to avoid the harsher chemos, but it seemed to cover all the grey very well.  I spent some time researching hair dyes see http://iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk/2013/06/colouring-hair-after-chemotherapy.html
Posts.Title: "Will my hair ever grow back?" Blog and pictures Chemobiyatch angelanature

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2014 06:39PM - edited Apr 1, 2014 06:39PM by BlueFox I had FEC-T where the T is Taxotare, and my hair grew back steadily once the chemo was finished.  I took pictures of the regrowth plus my "experiments" in colouring the chemo white fuzz.  If you are interested see:  http://iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk/p/chemo-hair-re...
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2014 02:20PM BlueFox wrote: In case anyone finds it useful, I got my husband to take photos of my hair regrowth and hair colouring experiments over serveral months. These can be seen here: http://iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk/p/chemo-hair-re... I had a few chemo curls in the first 6 months or so, but now it seems back to normal. The only hair I'm still missing is forearm air and armpit hair, not much to complain about...
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2013 01:20PM BlueFox wrote: I finished chemo in mid March 2013, so I am 5 months post-chemo.  I hardly used my wig - too scratchy!  I got some lovely soft merino beanies and wore them through the long winter. I started getting white fuzz within a month of finishing chemo.  By May 2013 I had a white buzzcut and I stopped wearing hair covering.  I loved just stroking my fuzz, it was so nice to have hair again.  I started colouring my hair in June 2013 (3 months after finishing chemo). My hair is now between 1 inch and 1.5 inches long. I've set up a special page on my blog to record the progress of the regrowth and the results of my hair colouring "experiments" http://iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk/p/chemo-hair-regrowth_16.html
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2014 02:28AM BlueFox wrote: My eyebrows and eyelashes came back really quickly - one week I didn't have any and the next they were there. The only thing I'm still missing is forearm arm and armpit hair
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2014 08:12AM BlueFox wrote: I finished chemotherapy a year ago and fortunately my head hair grew back steadily over the months and I now have nice hair again.   All my other body hair came back except for forearm hair and armpit hair.  I'm obviously not bothered about this but wondered why this hair was wiped out while everything else is ok? Is forearm hair was more vulnerable as the chemo drugs go into the arms?  Did I have a narrow escape from more serious hair loss?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 30, 2014 07:48PM BlueFox wrote: In case anyone finds it useful, I photographed my hair regrowth at regular intervals and also my experiments with colouring my fine white chemo hair:   http://iameclectica.blogspot.co.uk/p/chemo-hair-r... Eyebrows and eyelashes seem re-grow very differently to headhair - nothing visible then suddenly they are back to normal.

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2013 10:32AM BlueFox wrote: I finished radiotherapy a week ago.  But still feel tired/lacking in energy and red and sore.  I saw the onc registrar this morning and he said that the effects peak at 7/8 days after treatment finishes.   Did others notice this?  How long does it take before you start feeling much better?
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2013 06:53AM BlueFox wrote: I've now completed 20 out of my 25 treaments.  Only another week to go! My skin seems to be holding up.  Just a bit pink, but no soreness.  A couple of times a day I just slather on the Diplobase ointment they gave me at the hospital.  I wash with the bog standard aqueous cream (also supplied by hospital). But nothing else.
Posts.Title: Summer 2013 Rads Wildlyshel sandiesau
